Dow, Nasdaq and S&P all up at least 11%.
 
 "Stocks soared on Monday as a global push by governments to pump cash into banks fueled a rebound in financial shares and credit markets showed some signs of loosening up." www.TrulyNewsworthy.com
Hopefully this continues, but would like to add that compared to the financial rescue of other countries, the US' was reported as smaller.

With volume under 400 million, this is either a dead cat bounce or a reflex rally. There is no possible way this can stick in the long term (or the medium term...or the short term...depending on how short your short term is).

I was once told that if the stock market goes down my over 100pts it is a bad thing and if the stock market goes up over 100 pts it is also a bad thing. 
 
 In other words, huge swings mean volatile, not "the worst is over".

We have NEVER come roaring out of any bear market with massive gains. Eventually things settle out, stabilize, and then start to slowly climb. This is true in equity, commodity, and pretty much any other market you care to name. 
 
 This is the way bear markets are...massive volatility and low volume rallies. The one thing we can say for sure is that the rally is a sign that the bear market is NOT over.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Dow Soars 950pts!
